deIdi2b2.TEXT:
Record date: 2136-03-30
SDU JAR Admission Note
Uecker, Vastie
MR# 3038560
Date of Admission: 3/30/36
Attending: Dr. Zehr
Admitting Resident: Patricia Nunn
Source of history: records and pt
ID/CC: 62 yo F w/ hx of bronchiectasis s/p lobectomy, chronic MAC, HTN, fibromyalgia, and raynaud s presented to OSH w/ chest pain, transferred to PCH w/NSTEMI and DVTs.
HPI: Pt at baseline occasionally gets SOB from her bronchiectasis if she has not had chest PT recently but otherwise is able to walk up multiple flights of stairs without SOB. She has no known cardiac hx but does have HTN and + fam hx of early CAD. Pt awoke this morning in her USOH but quickly had sudden onset of 10/10 sharp SSCP radiating to her right arm associated w/ right arm numbness. Pain is slightly better w/ sitting up though pt denies pleuritic quality. She then had a vasovagal attack, which she has had before in the setting of pain, and she started to feel lightheaded, nauseated, and diaphoretic. She laid down on the floor and elevated her legs above her head which helped a little. Her husband gave her Excedrin w/o improvement and called 911. EMS gave her 3 puffs of NTG and 4 baby ASA w/o effect. The ambulance brought her to the closest hospital, Colorow. In the ED, she was found to be hypertensive w/ SBP 180s, for which she was started on TNG gtt. She also underwent PE CT which per report was neg for PE but showed bilat DVTs, and she was started on heparin. She was given fioricet, zofran, and fentanyl for her CP w/ relief. She was then given a dose of IV lopressor and also had one episode of N/V. Her labs were significant for + cardiac markers: 1st set w/ CK/MB/index 39/0.9/2.3, trop I 0.03, 2nd 443/57.3/12.9, trop 2.22, 3rd set 686/87.3/12.7, trop 4.18. EKGs showed right-bundle morphology (though QRS not wide) w/ initial TWI V1-V3 which progressed to deepening TWI V1-V4 and some downsloping STD V3-V4. Pt is currently chest pain free, no SOB, no palpitations. She denies any preceding viral illness or any surprises or acute stressors in her life, though she has many chronic medical problems.
ROS: as per HPI
PMH:
1. History of bronchiectasis s/p right middle lobectomy in 2128.
2. History of MAC with treatment interrupted by hepatitis in 2128.
3. Perforated diverticulitis with sigmoid resection in 2129.
4. Raynaud's.
5. Fibromyalgia.
6. Migraine.
7. Hypertension.
8. GERD.
9. Hiatal and ventral hernia.
10. Status post appendectomy.
11. Osteopenia.
12. Hx of serum sickness in the setting of Amox-clavulanate 11/33
13. Mild pectus excavatum noted on CXR
14. hx of Ophthalmic (V1) zoster in 10s
15. hx of R OM c/b mild hearing loss (2130)
16. newly-diagnosed DM
Medications:
1. Albuterol Nebulizer NEB 2.5 MG BID
2. Ascorbic Acid (Vitamin C) PO 500 MG BID
3. Dicloxacillin PO 250 MG QID
4. Docusate Sodium (Colace ) PO 100 MG BID
5. Butalbital+Apap+Caffeine (Fioricet) PO 1 TAB Q4H prn headache
6. Estradiol Tabs (Estradiol Patch ) PO 2 MG QD
7. Medroxyprogesterone PO 5 MG QD
8. Multivitamins (Multivitamin) PO 1 TAB QD
9. Nortriptyline Hcl (Nortriptyline ) PO 75 MG QHS
10. Omeprazole PO 20 MG QD
11. Propranolol Extended Release (Inderal La) PO 240 mg QD
Allergies: percocet/darvon/codeine GI upset, sulfa kidney problem, throat closed flagyl throat closed
SH: married, no children, lives w/ husband, retired firefighter
Tob: none
EtOH: none
Illicits: Negative
FH: mother w/ multiple MIs (first age 40s), HTN, scleroderma, raynaud s
Exam: VS: T=99.4 HR= 77 BP 135/64 RR= 18 SaO2= 98%2L
general: NAD, soft voice
HEENT: OP w/ MMM, NCAT
Skin: No rashes
Neck: Supple, full ROM, 2+ carotids w/o bruits, JVP 7 cm
Chest: decreased BS, CTAB
CVS: RRR, nl S1 S2, no rub
Abd: nl BS, soft, non-tender, nondistended, no organomegaly, midline scar well-healed
Extr: 2+ radial pulses, 2+ femoral pulses w/o bruits bilat, no LE edema, 2+ DPs bilaterally
Neuro: alert and oriented x3, grossly intact
DATA: pending
Chem:

DIFFERENTIAL REQUEST RECEIVED

Absolute EOS 0.08 L (0.1-0.3) th/cmm

Aniso None (None)
Hypo None (None)
Macrocytes None (None)
Microcytes None (None)
Micro:
pending
PE CT (reviewed w/ ED rads here): no PE to the level of subsegmental arteries, no dissection, no pericardial effusion or bowing of interventricular septum to suggest RV strain, lung parenchyma w/ scattered nodules, largest 6.5 mm, bilat fem veins w/ filling defects
EKG: NSR 78 bpm, IVCD w/ right-bundle morphology unchanged w/ TWI V1-V2, flat Ts I, avL, 1 mm downsloping STD V3, < 1 mm horizontal STD V4
TTE: prelim read RV and LV function wnl, no segmental WMA
Impression: 62 yo F w/ hx of bronchiectasis s/p lobectomy, chronic MAC, HTN, fibromyalgia, and raynaud s presented to OSH w/ chest pain, transferred to PCH w/ NSTEMI and DVTs, now chest pain free. Possible etiologies for her chest pain w/ + cardiac markers include ACS, PE, myopericarditis, spasm, or apical ballooning syndrome. Dissection less likely w/ equal pulses and not seen on PE CT. Her EKG changes suggest an element of RV strain, though this is not borne out on TTE, and review of her OSH CT w/ radiology here did not reveal PEs (at least to the level of subsegmental arteries). Her TTE did not show WMA, and her story could be c/w ACS or c/w myopericarditis or apical ballooning syndrome (esp w/ hx of fibromyalgia, raynaud s, migraines, etc), though w/ + cardiac enzymes and dynamic EKG changes, need to have low threshold to cath if develops pain.
Plan:
1. ischemia
bblocker, ASA
check fasting lipids, start statin
cont heparin, restart TNG gtt if pain recurs
start IIbIIIa if persistent pain
2. rhythm
NSR
On bblocker
3. ? DVT/PE
check LENIS
cont heparin
4. leukocytosis
cx if spikes
f/u urine cx
5. MAC
cont dicloxacillin
6. DM
RISS
Diabetic diet
7. FEN
Monitor hyponatremia (dates back at least as far as 10/35)
8. prophy
heparin
nexium
FULL CODE (per my discussion w/ pt)
